name: POLYGOD (itch)
description:
Polygod is an infinite inverse Space Invaders-styled game where the player plays as God's hands and protects the Earth from nuclear missiles coming down onto it, however, the catch is that the player mustn't block the missiles coming up either. The game increases its difficulty the further the player goes.

Polygod requires a Twin-Stick Controller. Polygod was initially developed for an arcade cabinet that utilized both sticks to control each hand:
Left Stick controls the left hand.
Right Stick controls the right hand.
A Button starts the game.


Polygod was created by the University of Nebraska Omaha Game Design Club, it was the first successful game the club developed. This game was created during the [Insert Game Here] local game jam.
It was the first game I worked on that had six members work on it. The team wasn't keen on doing 3D, so I met in the middle and created prerendered art so our game had a unique appearance to it.


I was the artistic lead and initial concept designer.
Programming was done by Ryan Bahn, Grant McCarty, Adam Hahn, Alex Ramsey.
Additional art was created by Danny Freitas (Devil's cup, nuclear bombs).
Quality assurance was done by Grant McCarty.
Music was done by Ryan Bahn, Grant McCarty and Alex Ramsey.
